data.name: richTextBox1.Text
data.value:
General: This software is intended for the use of game designer as a tool to help them design a background for video games using 2D tile sets.
I. Layer Help Button: This window allows users to track the number of layers added to the map. Through this window you can: 1. Hide or show an existing layer, 2. Move up or down an existing layer, 3. Add a layer, 4. Remove an existing layer, 5. Duplicate an existing layer, or 6. Rename a layer
Help Steps: Hide or show an existing layer simply press the Toggle Visibility button on the bottom of the layer window. Once pressed the visibility status of the layer will show next to its name. Move up or down an existing layer: Click the arrow pointing up on the Layer window to bring the layer up or the arrow pointing down to bring the layer down. The higher up the layer is in the layer window the further back it is on the map. Add a layer: Press the Add icon on the bottom of the Layer window. Remove an existing layer: Press the Remove Layer icon on the bottom of the Layer window. Duplicate an existing layer: Press the Duplicate Layer icon on the bottom of the Layer window. Rename a layer: Press the Rename icon on the bottom of the Layer window. Type the desired name in the New Name box, then click OK.
Note: You can also accomplish the tasks above by clicking the Layer menu then choose the corresponding option.
II. Tileset Window: This window allows users to view the uploaded tiles (images) and make a selection of tiles to place in the map window. Through this window you can: 1. Make a selection of tiles.
Help Steps: 1. To make a selection of tiles simply click on the top left corner of the first tile you wish to select and drag down to the right bottom corner. Let go of the mouse when selection is accomplished.
Note: You can click the middle mouse and scroll while holding it down to navigate through the Tileset window and view additional previously uploaded tiles.
III. Minimap Window: This window captures a smaller view of the entire map. It allows the user to view a smaller version of the entire map in one window. Through this window you can: 1. Do a fast Scroll to a hidden part of the map.
Help Steps: 1. To do a fast scroll to a hidden part of the map through your minimap window simply use click and hold the left mouse button and move the mouse a little to any direction. The map will instantly scroll to that same part of the minimap that you clicked.
